revised_title: Sorption from a Constant Volume: Measurement of Diffusion Coefficients
tldr: The authors present a method for measuring diffusion coefficients in solids by sorption from a constant and limited volume of a well-stirred fluid. They provide the necessary equations and demonstrate their application through various experiments. This method offers advantages over constant-pressure methods and can be used for various materials, such as plastics, rubber, metals, and porous adsorbents.
